intro: Plagiobothrys tener var. tener, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
